gov.ncbi.pmc.dtdanalyzer

Class DTDEventHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.ncbi.pmc.dtdanalyzer.DTDEventHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContentHandler, ErrorHandler, DeclHandler, LexicalHandler

    public class DTDEventHandler
extends Object
implements ContentHandler, ErrorHandler, DeclHandler, LexicalHandler
    Collects and stores information about elements, attributes, and entities declared in a DTD. Class can then be queried for this information. Class should only be used with a parser that supports the LexicalHandler and DeclHandler interfaces. This has been tested using Xerces, which is the preferred XML reader implementation.
    Version:
    1.0 2005-11-09
    Author:
    Demian Hess

      • setDocumentLocator

        public void setDocumentLocator(Locator locator)
        Sets locator that identifies the DTD file in which a declaration occurs. The locator must be set in order to process a DTD. If the locator remains null, the class methods will generate a SAXException.
        Specified by:
        setDocumentLocator in interface ContentHandler
        Parameters:
        locator - Reports location information from the DTD during parsing

      • startDocument

        public void startDocument()
                   throws SAXException
        Reinitializes all values so that declaration information can be collected
        Specified by:
        startDocument in interface ContentHandler
        Throws:
        SAXException - Indicates problem occurred during processing

      • startElement

        public void startElement(String str,
                String str1,
                String str2,
                Attributes attributes)
                  throws SAXException
        Ends DTD processing because the parser has reached content. This method should never be encountered if the document has a DTD because processing will end when endDTD is called. Some documents, however, may not have a DTD.
        Specified by:
        startElement in interface ContentHandler
        Parameters:
        str - Uri of namespace
        str1 - localName of element
        str2 - Full name of element, including prefix
        attributes - Element attributes
        Throws:
        EndOfDTDException - Indicates that processing should end
        SAXException

        public void attributeDecl(String eName,
                 String aName,
                 String type,
                 String valueDefault,
                 String value)
                   throws SAXException
        Creates a new Attribute using the declaration information provided by the XML Reader
        Specified by:
        attributeDecl in interface DeclHandler
        Parameters:
        eName - Element name
        aName - Attribute name
        type - Type of content of the attribute (eg, CDATA)
        valueDefault - The mode, such as "#IMPLIED"; null if not specified
        value - Default value or null if none
        Throws:
        SAXException - Thrown if the XML Reader did not supply a Locator or some other problem occurred
